title: If ⅔ of a sum of money is $22 then what is the sum of money? - Quora

response.answer_text: This question is too easy for anyone in science or engineering, let alone math. (For accounting students, too.) But I was an English major who many years ago used to tutor simple algebra. So let me assume the question is serious and answer it. Here are the simple steps. First decide what you’re trying to find and make that object x. In this case, you’re looking for the “sum of money.” So let x = the sum of money Then, using x for the sum of money, translate the first clause (the statement) into an equation. In this simple example, algebra is just a very simple language. So 2/3*x = 22 (I’m using an asterisk for “times” because of the typing mode. You don’t really need a times sign here if you are able to put the 2 over the 3, which I can’t; but it’s all the same.) Now that you have an equation with one unknown (x), you can just solve the equation. Here’s step-by-step: Multiply both sides by 3 to get rid of the fraction. (You can do just about anything not involving 0 to one side as long as you do it to the other side.) So now you have 2x = 66 Now divide both sides by 2 to see what x equals. (Of course 1x is just written as x.) x = 33 Now see if you can say the answer in terms of the original question. So, “The sum of money is $33.”

In the first place, you need to omit the word “if;” “if” implies a hypothetical interjection of a situation of uncertainty, which is what mathematics and the mathematics of finance and economics seeks, fundamentally, to eliminate; so, the statement is as such… of a sum (quantity of money) is equal to $22 thus→ →or commuting the conditions;  then .

Solution 2/3 x = $22 Keep x on the left side and move 2/3 to the right side. x = $22 ÷ 2/3 Divide the whole number by fraction. (multiply the whole number by the reciprocal of the fraction. x= $22 × 3/2 = $66÷2 = $33 (the sum of money)

$33 PREMISES 2/3 of x=22 ASSUMPTIONS Let x= the sum of money in $ CALCULATIONS 2/3 of x=22 2/3x=22 (2/3)/(2/3)x=22/(2/3) 1x=22(3/2) x=66/2 (Cancel the 2 in the denominator and adjust the numerator)= x=33/1 x= 33 PROOF If x=33, the equations (1) 2/3(33)=22 (2) 66/3=22 and (3) 22=22 establish that x=33 is root of the expression above C.H.
If 2/3 = 22 then 1/3 = 11 because 22/2 = 11 If 1/3 is 11, you’d add 11+11+11 So, the sum of money would be $33.
